Package game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A board of a given height and width

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.util.List<java.util.List<game.tuile.Earth>> islands  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board​(int width, int height)
      initialises a new board for the game with the given height and the given width then fills every case of the board with a sea tile (it is not the final board it would be modified later to add earth tiles)

      • exploreIsland

        public java.util.List<game.tuile.Earth> exploreIsland​(game.tuile.Earth Start,
                                                      java.util.Set<game.tuile.Earth> visited)
        Explores an island starting from a given Earth tile and returns a list of all connected Earth tiles. This method uses a breadth-first search (BFS) algorithm to traverse the island.
        Parameters:
        Start - the starting Earth tile from which the exploration begins
        visited - a set of Earth tiles that have already been visited
        Returns:
        a list of Earth tiles representing the explored island

      • findIslands

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<game.tuile.Earth>> findIslands()
        Finds and returns a list of islands on the board. An island is defined as a contiguous group of Earth tiles. This method iterates through all the tiles on the board, and for each Earth tile that has not been visited, it explores the island starting from that tile and adds it to the list of islands.
        Returns:
        a list of islands, where each island is represented as a list of Earth tiles.

      • getRandomBuildableTile

        public game.tuile.Earth getRandomBuildableTile()
        Retrieves a random buildable tile from the board. A buildable tile is an instance of Earth that does not have a building on it.
        Returns:
        a random Earth object that is buildable, or null if no buildable tiles are available.
